chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarrad M Gaede was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Retain Possession (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other probation now serving

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must enroll in and successfully complete a GED or HSED as directed by your probation agent.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  The provider is to be determined by DOC.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment agent deems appropriate.  Provider is to be determined by DOC.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.

Defendant is not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed in the State of Wisconsin.  You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with Dana C.

If agent deems appropriate you must submit to and successfully complete a mental health evaluation and must comply with any recommended treatment, counseling, or programming.  Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.  When your agent deems appropriate you must write a letter to Officer Goodness regarding the wrongfulness of your conduct and how drug use caused your poor judgment.  You must comply with any other recommendations of your probation agent.

Defendant appeared with counsel James Ritland.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  1 minor change/correction was noted in the PSI by each counsel.  DA recommends 5 years probation with conditions and 1-2 years jail as a condition of probation.  Attorney Ritland requests Court accept DOC's recommendation.  Defendant speaks.  Court orders:  14CF96 Ct 2 - sentence withheld and placed on 3 years probation; Ct 3 - sentence withheld and placed on probation for 5 years and 1 year jail as a condition of probation; Ct 4 - sentence withheld and placed on 1 year probation.  On 14CF95 Court orders on Ct 4 - sentence is withheld and placed on 1 year probation. All probation terms are concurrent.  Must report to jail on or before February 23, 2015 by 6:00 p.m.  If found to be violating any of the probation conditions prior to reporting to jail defendant is to be incarcerated immediately.  Court ordered 193 days sentence credit only to be applied if probation is revoked.  Other probation conditions are:  If agent deems appropriate you must submit to and successfully complete a mental health evaluation and must comply with any recommended treatment, counseling, or programming.  Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.  When your agent deems appropriate you must write a letter to Officer Goodness regarding the wrongfulness of your conduct and how drug use caused your poor judgment.  Must submit to a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your probation agent.  Defendant is not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed in the State of Wisconsin.  You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with Dana C.  Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment agent deems appropriate.  Provider is to be determined by DOC.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  The provider is to be determined by DOC.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer.  Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Must enroll in and successfully complete a GED or HSED as directed by your probation agent.

Sentencing hearing at 02-16-2015 01:30 pm

sent copy of PSI to Judge for review.

This bond includes cases 14CF95 and 14CF96:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Not to leave the state of Wisconsin without the Courts approval. Curfew 9:00 p.m. - 6:00 a.m..   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: victim Greg S. or his residence.  Amended 12-08-14:  Must report to PSI writer immediately as requested.
NO appearance by defendant.  Attorney James Ritland appeared on behalf of defendant.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Request to change bond denied.

Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail with attorney Jim Ritland present.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Judge reviewed plea questionnaire, rights, charges & penalties and elements with defendant.  Defendant pled to Counts 2, 3, 4.  Will be set for sentencing and PSI ordered.  Cash bond was reduced and conditions amended.
Plea hearing on December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on December 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.
